Description: Bust of Constantine, left, laureate, draped; globe and sceptre in left hand; mappa in right hand. (obverse)
Jupiter standing left, chlamys across left shoulder; left hand, sceptre; right hand, Victory on globe. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: John de Monins Johnson
Bibliographic references: RIC7 / The Roman Imperial Coinage, vol. 7: Constantine and Licinius AD 313-337 (8, p.644)
O'Connell et al 2014 / Antinoupolis at the British Museum (62)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Constantine the Great
